duties_responsibilities.duty: Interview patients to obtain necessary identification information and prepare required forms for treatment, billing, or record release authorization.
Apply ID bands to patients, have contact with insurance companies, and educate patients about Advance Directives and Charity Care when necessary.
Enter arriving patients into the computer system for processing and throughput, and represent various ancillary areas as a liaison between patients and staff.
Assist departments with projects and various duties deemed by Management staff.
Obtain correct identification information, demographic, guarantor, and insurance coverage. Enter necessary information for payment and scan documents into the Electronic Document Imaging.
Interpret Payor Website, E-paces, HDX, and enter responses into the registration system. Obtain authorizations, referrals, and per-certs for payments.
Ensure appropriate explanations, consents, and authorizations are signed, documented, and distributed to relevant locations.
Attach I.D. bands to patients according to medical center policy, offer a copy of the Patient Bill Of Rights, review Advance Directives, and advise patients of valuable policies and services.
Accurately enter physician orders into the computer system, collect payments, issue receipts, and balance daily receipts and transactions.
Utilize RAS reports to facilitate patient movement, check and compare patient data for accuracy, and communicate movements with relevant staff.
Attend and participate in departmental staff meetings, demonstrate knowledge of departmental projects, and show a teamwork ethic.
Assist patients with applying or securing insurance coverage, demonstrate knowledge of Patient Access Emergency Management process, OAS/Invasion, and system downtime procedures.
Demonstrate excellent customer service skills, knowledge of systems, and uphold departmental dress policy.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalency. Understanding of Medical Terminology.
